Title: Conversion factors areas (conversion from number to weight) used in the IRD Tuna Atlas
Description:
abstract:Areas used for the conversion of catches from number of fishes harvested to weigth. These areas are known to have quite distinct average weights.
For additional information, see: http://mdst-macroes.ird.fr/documentation/databases/Sardara/docSardara/doc_processes/Weight_computation_manu.odt
Creator:
owner:ird@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr;alain.fonteneau@ird.fr_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:paul.taconet@ird.fr_
principalInvestigator:emmanuel.chassot@ird.fr
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database_
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: Areas used in the Nominal catches (task 1) dataset of the IOTC
Description: abstract:The areas used in the nominal catches (task 1) dataset of the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission (IOTC). These areas are the FAO fishing areas F51 and F57.
Creator:
owner:ird@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr;fabio.fiorellato@iotc.org_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:secretariat@iotc.org_
principalInvestigator:fabio.fiorellato@iotc.org
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The IOTC task  (nominal catch) public domain datasets was downloaded on the IOTC website._
process: The codes and labels used for areas in these datasets were identified. A code list for areas was reconstitued._
process: These areas correspond to the FAO fishing areas, hence, the geographical component of the code list was reconstitued from the FAO fishing area geospatial code list available and downlaoded here: http://www.fao.org/geonetwork/srv/en/main.home?uuid=aca-da-dc-d-fbd_
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database_
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: Geospatial code list - areas used in catch-and-effort datasets (task 1) by the five tuna RFMOs
Description: abstract:Code list for areas used in catch-and-efforts (task 1) datasets by the five tuna Regional Fisheries Management Organisations (IOTC, ICCAT, IATTC, WCPFC, CCSBT).
Creator:
owner:ird@ird.fr,emmanuel.blondel@fao.org;carlos.palma@iccat.int;laurent.floch@ird.f_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:paul.taconet@ird.fr_
principalInvestigator:emmanuel.chassot@ird.fr
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The code lists used as input of this code list were downloaded/composed and integrated into the Tuna atlas database._
process: Trough a SQL query perfomed on the Tuna atlas database: the code list was generated by merging (UNION) all the source code lists._
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: Code list for types of catch used by CCSBT
Description: abstract:Code list for types of catches used by the Commission for the Conservation of Southern Bluefin Tuna (CCSBT). Presently, the CCSBT does not have any catch type code list, since the public datasets do not contain a catch type stratification. This table was created by the database manager in order to standardize the organization of the code lists and to facilitate the integration of the data within the Sardara database.
Creator:

Title: Code list for units of fishing effort used by ICCAT
Description: abstract:Code list for units of fishing effort used by the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (ICCAT). This code list was built using as input both the code list available in the ICCAT website and the ICCAT public domain datasets.

owner:ird@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr;carlos.palma@iccat.int_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:info@iccat.int_
principalInvestigator:carlos.palma@iccat.int
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The code list of units of efforts released by ICCAT and available in the ICCAT website at this url: https://www.iccat.int/en/Stat_Codes.htm was downloaded._
process: Since the codes in this code list does not englobe all the codes for units of efforts used in the ICCAT public domain datasets, the latter were collated._
process: The codes and labels used for species in these datasets were identified. A code list for species was reconstitued._
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database_
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: Code list for units of fishing effort used in the IRD Tuna Atlas
Description: abstract:Code list for units of fishing effort used in the French National Research Institute for Sustainable Development (IRD) global Tuna Atlas. This code list is the unique combination of the codes of units of fishing effort coming from the 5 tuna RFMOs (one single code was kept for each unit of fishing effort to create this code list).
Creator:
owner:ird@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:paul.taconet@ird.fr_
principalInvestigator:emmanuel.chassot@ird.fr
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: All the codes of units of fishing effort coming from the  tuna RFMOs were collated._
process: The unique combination of these codes was manually extracted, i.e. one single code was kept for each unit of fishing effort. _
process: The resulting CSV file was integrated into the Tuna atlas database._
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: FAO fishing areas
Description: abstract:Major Fishing Areas for Statistical Purposes are arbitrary areas, the boundaries of which were determined in consultation with international fishery agencies on various considerations, including (i) the boundary of natural regions and the natural divisions of oceans and seas; (ii) the boundaries of adjacent statistical fisheries bodies already established in inter-governmental conventions and treaties; (iii) existing national practices; (iv) national boundaries; (v) the longitude and latitude grid system; (vi) the distribution of the aquatic fauna; and (vii) the distribution of the resources and the environmental conditions within an area.
Creator:
owner:FAO-HQ@fao.org,paul.taconet@ird.fr_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
principalInvestigator:emmanuel.chassot@ird.fr
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The code list was downloaded on the FAO Geonetwork _
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database._
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: Standard country or area codes for statistical use
Description:
abstract:The list of countries or areas contains the names of countries or areas in alphabetical order, their three-digit numerical codes used for statistical processing purposes by the Statistics Division of the United Nations Secretariat, and their three-digit alphabetical codes assigned of the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).1 In general, this list of countries or areas includes those countries or areas for which statistical data are compiled by the Statistics Division of the United Nations Secretariat.

The names of countries or areas refer to their short form used in day-to-day operations of the United Nations and not necessarily to their official name as used in formal documents. These names are based on the United Nations Terminology Database (UNTERM).2 The designations employed and the presentation of material at this site do not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of the Secretariat of the United Nations concerning the legal status of any country, territory, city or area or of its authorities, or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries.
Creator:
owner:ird@ird.fr,statistics@un.org_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:_
principalInvestigator:statistics@un.org
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The code list was downloaded on the -- at this url: ftp://ftp.fao.org/FI/DOCUMENT/cwp/handbook/country.pdf reached through this web page: http://www.fao.org/fishery/cwp/handbook/D/en _
process: The code list was transformed in CSV format._
process: A column named continent_sting containing the label of the continent associated to the country or area was added to the code list._
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database._
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: The Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical, High-resolution Geography Database
Description: abstract:The Global Self-consistent, Hierarchical, High-resolution Geography Database (GSHHG) is a high-resolution geography data set including coastlines, political borders, and rivers available for file download in either ESRI shapefile format or in a native binary format. In the database we use the low resolution (l); product 1 (coastlines). version 2.3.4 (January 1, 2015)

owner:ncei.info@noaa.gov,ncei.info@noaa.gov_

Title: ICCAT stock areas
Description:
abstract:The stock areas of the International Commission for the Conservation of Atlantic Tunas (ICCAT). In absence of information regarding the geospatial component for these areas, the whole ICCAT area of competence was set for all the codes of this code list.
Additional informations can be found here: https://www.iccat.int/Data/ICCAT_maps.pdf
Creator:
owner:ird@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr;carlos.palma@iccat.int_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_

principalInvestigator:carlos.palma@iccat.int
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The ICCAT task  public domain dataset was downloaded on the ICCAT website._
process: The codes and labels used for sampling areas in these datasets were identified. A code list for stock areas was reconstitued._
process: The geographical component of this code list was added. In absence of information regarding the geospatial component for these areas, the whole ICCAT area of competence was set for all the codes of this code list._
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database.
_
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: International Standard Classification of Fishing Gears (ISSCFG Rev.1)
Description: abstract:The International Standard Statistical Classification of Fishing Gear (ISSCFG) was originally adopted during the 10th Session of the CWP (Madrid, 22-29 July 1980). The revised Classification - ISSCFG Revision 1 (Annex M II) - has been endorsed and adopted for CWP Member's implementation by the CWP at its 25th Session (Rome, 23-26 February 2016).

owner:FAO-HQ@fao.org,luca.garibaldi@fao.org_

Title: ASFIS List of Species for Fishery Statistics Purposes
Description:
abstract:The FAO Fisheries and Aquaculture Statistics and Information Branch (FIAS) collates world capture and aquaculture production statistics at either the species, genus, family or higher taxonomic levels in 2 269 statistical categories (2015 data) referred to as species items.

ASFIS list of species includes 12 721 species items selected according to their interest or relation to fisheries and aquaculture. For each species item stored in a record, codes (ISSCAAP group, taxonomic and 3-alpha) and taxonomic information (scientific name, author(s), family, and higher taxonomic classification) are provided. An English name is available for most of the records, and about one third of them have also a French and Spanish name. Information is also provided about the availability of fishery production statistics on the species item in the FAO databases.
Creator:
owner:FAO-HQ@fao.org,luca.garibaldi@fao.org_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:luca.garibaldi@fao.org_
principalInvestigator:luca.garibaldi@fao.org
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The code list was downloaded on the -- at this url: http://www.fao.org/fishery/static/ASFIS/ASFIS_sp.zip reached through this web page: http://www.fao.org/fishery/collection/asfis/en_
process: The code list was transformed in CSV format._
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database._
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

process: The code list of species released by ICCAT and available in the ICCAT website at this url: https://www.iccat.int/en/Stat_Codes.htm was downloaded._
process: Since the codes in this code list does not englobe all the codes for species used in the ICCAT public domain datasets, the latter were collated._
process: The codes and labels used for species in these datasets were identified. A code list for species was reconstitued._
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database_
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr

Title: VLIZ Exclusive Economic Zones Boundaries (EEZ)
Description:
abstract:This dataset builds on previous versions of the world's EEZ. In version 9, the 200 nautical miles outer limit was completely recalculated using a higher resolution coastline as a normal baseline (ESRI Countries 2014) and straight baselines, where available. This dataset consists of two shapefiles: polylines that represent the maritime boundaries of the world's countries, the other one is a polygon layer representing the Exclusive Economic Zone of countries. This dataset also contains digital information about treaties, joint regime, and disputed boundaries.

Preferred citation:
Flanders Marine Institute (2018). Maritime Boundaries Geodatabase: Maritime Boundaries and Exclusive Economic Zones (200NM), version 10. Available online at http://www.marineregions.org/ https://doi.org/10.14284/312.
Creator:
owner:info@marineregions.org,info@marineregions.org_
metadata:paul.taconet@ird.fr;julien.barde@ird.fr;emmanuel.blondel@fao.org_
pointOfContact:paul.taconet@ird.fr_
principalInvestigator:emmanuel.chassot@ird.fr
Provenance:
statement:Data management workflow_
process: The code list was downloaded on the Marine regions website_
process: The code list was integrated into the Tuna atlas database._
processor: paul.taconet@ird.fr,paul.taconet@ird.fr
